available_updates.title: Knowledge Evolution System
available_updates.user_benefit: Keep your project knowledge current with automatic update detection, source monitoring, and guided knowledge refresh workflows
setup_guide: The knowledge-evolution agent is now available in your project
Activate it by saying: 'Check for knowledge updates'
Configure update sources in {directories.knowledge}/manifest.json under evolution settings
Set preferred update mode: stability_first (default), awareness_hybrid, or freshness_first

available_updates.title: Algorithmic Trading Patterns
available_updates.description: Advanced technical indicators, fundamental data, backtesting frameworks
available_updates.user_benefit: Build sophisticated trading strategies with technical indicators (RSI, MACD, Bollinger), fundamental data analysis, and backtesting frameworks
setup_guide: Trading patterns knowledge is now available to your agents
Reference it in agent definitions via knowledge: [trading-patterns.json]
Includes: Technical indicators, backtesting patterns, risk management, fundamental data

available_updates.title: CrewAI Patterns Update
available_updates.description: Flows, Pipelines, and Knowledge patterns for CrewAI
available_updates.user_benefit: Build multi-agent systems with CrewAI Flows, Pipelines, and Knowledge integration for complex orchestration scenarios
setup_guide: CrewAI patterns are now available to your agents
Reference via knowledge: [crewai-patterns.json] in agent definitions
Includes: Flow patterns, Pipeline orchestration, Knowledge integration, Tool binding

available_updates.title: Debug Conductor Agent
available_updates.description: Autonomous debugging agent with systematic error investigation and fix workflows
available_updates.user_benefit: Automatically investigate CI/CD failures, trace root causes, implement fixes, and learn from debugging patterns to prevent recurrence
setup_guide: The debug-conductor agent is now available in your project
Activate by saying: 'Fix the pipeline' or 'Debug this error'
For best results, configure git and github MCP servers for CI log access
The agent learns from each debugging session and stores patterns in {directories.knowledge}/debug-patterns.json

available_updates.title: Grounding Verification
available_updates.description: Two-pass verification for LLM output grounding against source data
available_updates.user_benefit: Verify that agent outputs are grounded in real source data, preventing hallucination and ensuring trustworthy results
setup_guide: Grounding verification skill is now available to all agents
Agents can use it automatically when making claims that need verification
Activate explicitly by saying: 'Verify this against source'

available_updates.title: Integrity Guardian Enhancement
available_updates.description: Enhanced Layer 0 Guardian with fabricated-data detection and expanded harm patterns
available_updates.user_benefit: Stronger protection against harmful agent actions including detection of fabricated data in bug fixes, ensuring all agent output is truthful and verified
setup_guide: The enhanced Integrity Guardian replaces your existing guardian
No configuration needed - it operates automatically as part of Layer 0
New: Detects fabricated data in bug fixes (Level 3 Block)
available_updates.migration_notes: Replaces existing integrity-guardian.md with enhanced version including no-fake-data harm pattern

available_updates.title: Essential Tooling Package
available_updates.description: README structure validation, test catalog generation, CI/CD pipeline, PR checks, and language-specific .gitignore. Keeps project documentation and CI in sync automatically.
available_updates.user_benefit: Automatically detect when README counts drift, keep test catalogs current, and run CI validation on every push and PR.
setup_guide: Validate README: python {directories.scripts}/validation/validate_readme_structure.py --check
Generate test catalog: python {directories.scripts}/docs/generate_test_catalog.py
CI workflows are ready to use with GitHub Actions
Customize SCAN_CONFIG in validate_readme_structure.py for your project layout

available_updates.title: Standard Tooling Package
available_updates.description: Git automation with pre-commit hooks, safe commit wrapper, and hook installer. Prevents CI failures by auto-syncing artifacts on every commit.
available_updates.user_benefit: Never push broken commits again. Pre-commit hooks auto-fix documentation drift, block secrets, and validate JSON before every commit.
setup_guide: Install git hooks: python {directories.scripts}/git/install_hooks.py
Use safe commit: python {directories.scripts}/git/safe_commit.py 'your message'
Pre-commit runs automatically on every git commit after hook installation

available_updates.title: Advanced Tooling Package
available_updates.description: Secret scanning, changelog generation, and enhanced quality gates for teams requiring comprehensive automation.
available_updates.user_benefit: Detect leaked secrets before they reach version control, auto-generate changelogs from conventional commits, and validate dependency integrity.
setup_guide: Scan for secrets: python {directories.scripts}/guardian/secret_scanner.py --check
Generate changelog: python {directories.scripts}/updates/changelog_generator.py --generate
Add to CI: include secret_scanner.py --check as a CI step

available_updates.title: Documentation Sync Scripts
available_updates.description: README structure validation and test catalog generation with CI integration. A focused subset of the Essential tooling for documentation-only needs.
available_updates.user_benefit: Automatically detect when README project-structure counts drift from the filesystem, and keep a comprehensive test catalog up to date.
setup_guide: Validate README: python {directories.scripts}/validation/validate_readme_structure.py --check
Generate test catalog: python {directories.scripts}/docs/generate_test_catalog.py
Add the validate-docs CI job to your CI workflow for automatic checking

available_updates.title: AI Stack Knowledge Evolution 2026
available_updates.description: Comprehensive update of AI framework patterns: LangChain MCP adapters, LangGraph distributed workflows, Anthropic Advanced Tool Use, CrewAI A2A, DSPy 3.x MIPROv2, plus 7 new knowledge files for OpenAI Agents SDK, Pydantic AI, Google ADK, MCP patterns, AutoGen 0.4, Agent Memory 2026, and Advanced RAG 2026
available_updates.user_benefit: Build agents with the latest AI frameworks and patterns including OpenAI Agents SDK, Google ADK, Pydantic AI, MCP protocol, modern agent memory (Mem0), and advanced RAG (ColBERT, MA-RAG)
setup_guide: 13 knowledge files updated or created covering the latest AI framework patterns
Updated: langchain-patterns, langgraph-workflows, anthropic-patterns, crewai-patterns, dspy-patterns, autogen-patterns
New: openai-agents-sdk-patterns, pydantic-ai-patterns, google-adk-patterns, mcp-patterns, agent-memory-2026-patterns, advanced-rag-2026-patterns
Reference new patterns in agent definitions via knowledge: [openai-agents-sdk-patterns.json] etc.
Version registry updated with latest package versions and new agent_frameworks section
available_updates.migration_notes: autogen-patterns.json has been rewritten for AutoGen 0.4+ (event-driven architecture). If you have agents using AutoGen 0.2 patterns, review the migration_from_v0_2 section in the updated file.

available_updates.title: Living Documentation System
available_updates.description: Auto-generating reference docs, link validation, README count sync, INDEX regeneration, and file reorganization with cross-format reference fixing. Keeps all documentation in sync with the codebase automatically.
available_updates.user_benefit: Never have stale documentation again. Reference catalogs, README counts, and navigation indexes are regenerated automatically on every commit or on demand.
setup_guide: Generate all docs: python {directories.scripts}/tools/doc_generator.py --all
Validate links: python {directories.scripts}/tools/reorganize.py --validate --scan-root {directories.docs}/
Preview changes: python {directories.scripts}/tools/doc_generator.py --all --dry-run
Add to pre-commit: include doc_generator.py --all in your pre-commit hooks
Use doc-maintainer agent: say 'Maintain documentation' in Cursor

migration_handling.description: Check breaking_changes and migration_notes before applying updates to understand required manual steps
migration_handling.usage: Review update.breaking_changes flag and update.migration_notes before applying to production projects
migration_handling.use_when: Review update.breaking_changes flag and update.migration_notes before applying to production projects
migration_handling.code_example:
# Implement migration_handling per factory-updates patterns
# See description and related documentation
best_practices: Document the pattern usage and rationale in code comments
Validate implementation against domain requirements before deployment
Check factory-updates.json regularly (monthly or quarterly) to keep Factory-generated projects current with latest patterns
Use stable channel for production projects and latest channel only for early adopters willing to handle breaking changes
Review breaking_changes and migration_notes before applying updates to understand impact and required manual steps
Filter updates by applicable_to to only apply updates relevant to your blueprint, avoiding unnecessary changes
Backup project before applying updates, especially when breaking_changes is true or migration_notes require manual steps
Test updates in a branch or staging environment before applying to production to catch compatibility issues early
Keep factory_version in sync with actual Factory version used to generate project for accurate update recommendations
Document applied updates in project CHANGELOG.md to track evolution and help troubleshoot issues

anti_patterns.name: Update Blindness
anti_patterns.problem: Never checking factory-updates.json leads to missing important improvements, security fixes, and new capabilities
anti_patterns.fix: Schedule regular update checks (monthly/quarterly). Use receive-updates skill or manual URL to stay current

anti_patterns.name: Breaking Change Surprise
anti_patterns.problem: Applying updates with breaking_changes without reading migration_notes breaks production systems unexpectedly
anti_patterns.fix: Always review breaking_changes flag and migration_notes before applying. Test in staging first

anti_patterns.name: Update Spam
anti_patterns.problem: Applying all updates regardless of applicable_to field adds unnecessary changes and potential conflicts
anti_patterns.fix: Filter updates by applicable_to to only apply relevant updates. Use subscription_options for automatic filtering

anti_patterns.name: Version Mismatch
anti_patterns.problem: Applying updates from newer Factory versions to projects generated with older versions causes incompatibilities
anti_patterns.fix: Check factory_version compatibility before applying. Consider regenerating project if version gap is too large

anti_patterns.name: Unvalidated Updates
anti_patterns.problem: Applying updates without testing breaks production systems and requires emergency rollbacks
anti_patterns.fix: Always test updates in branch or staging environment. Validate JSON files and run tests after applying
